column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////We are from Philadelphia and we usually leave at least a 20% tip. Needless to say
column2: we did not leave a tip. I have never been so angry leaving a restaurant. There was some concern that the server would think we were cheap for not leaving a tip. However the experience was so horrible
column3: a tip was just not justified. In our party of eight
column4: four of us own our own restaurants in Philadelphia. We certainly understand that mishaps happen sometimes
column5: but we train our employees and servers to take care of the customers-always. With today's many business review websites
column6: an unhappy customer can easily post a negative review and spread his story of his/her bad experience across the web. I want our server Matt to read this and the reviews I will post. The experience was embarassing for your restaurant and for me since I had to explain our situation to the manager while other customers were there.
